question.body: Which of the following is not a function of the nervous system?

multiple_choice.choice: release chemicals into the bloodstream for distribution throughout the body
produce quick effects by electrochemical mechanisms

response.feedback: Correct. This is a function of the endocrine system, not the nervous system. Those chemicals are called hormones.

Incorrect. This is a correct function of the nervous system; some parts of the nervous system control voluntary skeletal muscles, while other parts control involuntary smooth and cardiac muscle and glands; hormones can also affect muscles and glands.
Incorrect. This is a function of the nervous system, as opposed to the endocrine system which produces hormones for a slower but longer duration effect on sometimes distant body tissues and cells.
Incorrect. This is a correct function of the nervous system, and the endocrine system.

part.hint: The nervous system will share some characteristics with the other major coordinating system, the endocrine system; but it will also have some major differences.
